basics.name: Panagiotis Riccardo Siavelis
basics.label: Senior Integration Engineer @ Qualco
basics.summary: I like effortful problems, whatever the programming language. Eager to enjoy the travel of undertaking challenging tasks along with coworkers, of course.

work.name: XM

- Drive Agile Ceremonies and coordinate closely with the Product owner for priorities and assessing the roadmap completion

work.name: The Ranch K.Skouras SA
work.summary:
Team Leader of a small group of campers (16 children). 
Responsabilities: 
- Take care of the team's campers and understand every's member needs. 
- Make the children have fun and at the same time obey the rules of the camping.
- Create strong relationships between the members of the team.
- Program the activities of the team's house in collaboration with the campers.
- Always know where the team member are. 
- Check the health of the members and inform the supervisor in case of sickness.
- Make sure that the house and the stuff of the members are kept clean.
- Cooperate and collaborate with other team leaders and other executives of the camping.

publications.name: An Improved GAN Semantic Image Inpainting
publications.summary: Image inpainting is used to fill in missing regions based on remaining image data. Although the existing methods, that use deep generative models to infer the missing content, produce realistic images, sometimes the results are unsatisfactory due to arithmetical issues caused by the use of unbalanced ingredients of the proposed cost functions. In this paper, we propose a loss that generates more plausible results. Experiments on two datasets show that our method predicts information in large missing regions and achieves pixel-level photorealism, significantly outperforming state-of-the-art methods [24] and [25]. Having improved the semantic image inpainting we focus on applying the method to laparoscopic images that suffer from glares. The modified technique again outperforms its rivals. Moreover, it is faster than classical PDE based inpainting techniques and, more importantly, its running time is almost independent on the size of missing area, both critical issues in medical image processing.

references.name: David Sarikas
references.reference:
I worked with Panagiotis in the same Business Stream. Him and I had a very close working relationship as he was leading the development team that was responsible to deliver and bring to life my requests. Panagiotis was leading  his team on delivering high quality products and features leveraging Agile Methodologies. 
Panagiotis was not just a team leader, but a mentor and a friend. His meticulous attention to detail, particularly evident in our Pandora Project, ensured its success. He fostered a collaborative environment where every team member felt valued and inspired and he ensured that the business requirements were translated into technical tasks for his team. 
Panagiotis departure leaves big shoes to fill, and any team would be lucky to have him. Best of luck in your future endeavors!
